channel.title: Reviewing National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS)
channel.description: Updated Reviewing National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS) content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Historical Information on the NAAQS Review Process
item.description:
EPA’s NAAQS review process has evolved over time. Below are Agency documents regarding changes to the NAAQS review process between 2005 and 2009. Written communication between the Agency and CASAC regarding the NAAQS process can be found at the following link: Correspondence with the Clean Air Scientific Advisory Committee.

You will need Adobe Reader to view some of the files on this page. See EPA’s About PDF page to learn more.

2009

Recognizing the importance of scientific integrity and transparency, Administrator Lisa P. Jackson reexamined the NAAQS review process and modifications to the process made in the last administration. On May 21, 2009 Administrator Jackson called for key changes to the NAAQS review process, including reinstating a policy assessment document that contains staff analyses of the scientific bases for alternative policy options for consideration by senior Agency management prior to rulemaking. This Policy Assessment document serves to “bridge the gap” between the scientific information and the judgments required of the Administrator in determining whether it is appropriate to retain or revise the standards. In conjunction with this change, EPA will no longer issue a policy assessment in the form of an Advance Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (ANPR).

  • Memo from EPA Administrator Jackson addressing revisit of NAAQS review process, May 21, 2009 (PDF) (5 pp, 280 K)
  • Letter to the Clean Air Scientific Advisory Committee conveying May 21, 2009 memo from Administrator Jackson (PDF)(2 pp, 80 K)

2005-2008

In December 2005, the EPA Deputy Administrator requested that the Office of Air and Radiation (OAR) and the Office of Research and Development (ORD) conduct a “top-to-bottom review” of the process the Agency uses in setting and reviewing NAAQS. Advice and recommendations were requested from current and former members of the CASAC and other stakeholder groups that had substantial experience with the NAAQS review process. On April 3, 2006, the working group issued a report outlining their conclusions and recommendations. 

April 3, 2006, EPA working group report on the NAAQS review process

  • Cover memo (PDF)(2 pp, 29 K)
  • Executive Summary (PDF)(4 pp, 22 K)
  • Report (PDF)(41 pp, 435 K)
  • Attachments (PDF)(76 pp, 1 M)

June 2006 Public Workshop
EPA held a public workshop on June 27, 2006 to discuss the process the Agency uses to review the NAAQS. The workshop provided the public the opportunity to present their views on the review process and to discuss the process with EPA officials. This workshop did not cover issues related to the ongoing review of any specific air quality standard.

  • List of speakers registered as of June 26, 2006 (PDF)(2 pp, 31 K)
  • June 27 workshop: Overview presentation by Lydia Wegman, Office of Air Quality Planning & Standards, and Kevin Teichman, Office of Research & Development (PDF)(9 pp, 165 K)
  • June 12, 2006: Federal Register Notice of Public Workshop to discuss the NAAQS Process (PDF)(3 pp, 181 K)

Public Comments
EPA received the following public comments on the process the Agency uses to review the NAAQS. Note: Additional comments can be found in the Attachments to the April 3, 2006 EPA working group report on the NAAQS review process.

  • Comments from the California Air Resources Board (PDF)(32pp, 109 K, June 21, 2006)
  • Comments from the Battery Council International (PDF)(3 pp, 130 K, July 12, 2006)

December 2006
EPA announced a revised process for reviewing and setting the Agency’s NAAQS. These changes were made to improve the efficiency of the NAAQS review process while ensuring that the Agency’s decisions are informed by the best available science in order to protect public health and the environment.

  • Memo from EPA Deputy Administrator Marcus Peacock outlining revised process (PDF)(3 pp, 218 K)

April 2007
EPA further modified the process for reviewing and setting the NAAQS to include review and advice from the CASAC on the second draft risk/exposure assessment reports, which will include estimated risks/exposures associated with potential alternative standards under consideration. 

  • Memo from EPA deputy Administrator Marcus Peacock outlining addition modifications to the new process (PDF)(2 pp, 145 K)
  • December 2006 memo from deputy Administrator Marcus Peacock (Attachment 1) (PDF)(3 pp, 219 K)
  • Revised Generic NAAQS Review Process (Attachment 2) (PDF)(1 pg, 32 K)

September 2008
EPA made additional changes to the NAAQS review process based on CASAC recommendations presented in a January 23, 2008 letter to the EPA Administrator. 

  • Letter from EPA Deputy Administrator Marcus Peacock to Dr. Rogene Henderson, Chair, CASAC, September 8, 2008 (PDF)(4 pp, 239 K)

Learn about the current review process.
item.dc:creator: rcopland

item.title: Ozone (O3) Standards - Federal Register Notices from Current Review
item.description:
Over the course of each NAAQS review, EPA publishes notices in the Federal Register for a variety of activities:  the kick-off workshop and call for information, CASAC meetings, availability of pre-rulemaking documents and opportunities for comment on these documents, as well as proposed and final rulemaking decisions and public hearings on a proposed rulemaking decision.

You will need Adobe Reader to view some of the files on this page. See EPA’s About PDF page to learn more.

Rulemaking Notices / Public Hearings

  • Review of National Ambient Air Quality Standards for Ozone, Final Rule (PDF)(178 pp, 2.3 M, October 26, 2015)
  • Review of National Ambient Air Quality Standards for Ozone, Proposed Rule (PDF)(179 pp, 1.9 M, December 17, 2014)
  • Announcing Public Hearings on Ozone Proposal (PDF)(3 pp, 224 K, December 31, 2014)

Pre-Rulemaking Documents / Availability and Opportunities for Public Comment

  • Notice of Availability – Final Policy Assessment and Final Risk and Exposure Assessments (PDF)(1 pp, 207 K, September 8, 2014)
  • Notice of Availability and Public Comment Periods - Second Draft Risk and Exposure Assessments and Second Draft Policy Assessment (PDF)(3 pp, 226 K, January 29, 2011)
  • Notice of Availability – Final Integrated Science Assessment (PDF)(2 pp, 221 K, February 15, 2013)
  • Notice of Extension of Public Comment Period - First Draft Risk and Exposure Assessments and First Draft Policy Assessment (PDF)(3 pp, 245 K, August 27, 2012)
  • Notice of Availability and Public Comment Periods for Draft Assessment Documents (PDF)(2 pp, 217 K, July 19, 2012)
  • Notice of Availability and Public Comment Period for Third External Review Draft Integrated Science Assessment for Ozone and Related Photochemical Oxidants (PDF)(3 pp, 246 K, June 19, 2012)
  • Notice of Extension of Public Comment Period - Second Draft Integrated Science Assessment (PDF)(2 pp, 149 K, November 28, 2011)
  • Notice of Availability and Public Comment Period for Second External Review Draft Integrated Science Assessment for Ozone and Related Photochemical Oxidants (PDF)(3 pp, 162 K, September 30, 2011)
  • Notice of Availability and Public Comment Period for Risk and Exposure Assessment Planning Documents; Notice of Availability for Final Integrated Review Plan (PDF)(3 pp, 197 K, April 4, 2011)
  • Notice of Extension of Public Comment Period - First Draft Integrated Science Assessment (PDF)(1 pp, 141 K, March 28, 2011)
  • Notice of Availability and Public Comment Period for Ozone ISA - First External Review Draft (PDF)(3 pp, 154 K, February 28, 2011)
  • Notice of Workshop and Call for Information on Integrated Science Assessment (PDF) (3 pp, 58 K, September 29, 2008)

Public Meetings / Workshops

  • Notification of CASAC Teleconference (if needed) on June 4, 2014 (correction notice) (PDF)(1 pg, 170 K, April 22, 2014)
  • Notification of CASAC Teleconference on May 28, 2014 (PDF)(2 pp, 178 K, March 13, 2014)
  • Notice of CASAC meeting on March 25 - 27, 2014 (PDF)(2 pp, 214 K, January 29, 2014)
  • Notice of CASAC Teleconference on November 5, 2012 (PDF)(2 pp, 197 K, October 19, 2012)
  • Notice of CASAC meeting on September 11 - 13, 2012 (PDF)(2 pp, 179 K, August 6, 2012)
  • Notice of CASAC meeting on January 9-10, 2012 (PDF)(2 pp, 147 K, December 8, 2011)
  • Notice of CASAC meeting on May 19-20, 2011 (PDF)(2 pp, 184 K, April 28, 2011)
  • Notice of CASAC Teleconference on November 13, 2009 (PDF)(2 pp, 51 K, October 22, 2009)
  • Notice of CASAC Consultation on March 30, 2009 (PDF)(1 pg, 60 K, February 19, 2009)
  • Notice of Workshop and Call for Information on Integrated Science Assessment (PDF)(3 pp, 88 K, September 29, 2009)

You may also be interested in other documents from the current ozone NAAQS review.
item.dc:creator: rcopland

item.title: Sulfur Dioxide (SO2) Primary Air Quality Standards - Federal Register Notices from Current Review
item.description:
Over the course of each NAAQS review, EPA publishes notices in the Federal Register for a variety of activities:  the kick-off workshop and call for information, CASAC meetings, availability of pre-rulemaking documents and opportunities for comment on these documents, as well as proposed and final rulemaking decisions and public hearings on a proposed rulemaking decision.

You will need Adobe Reader to view some of the files on this page. See EPA’s About PDF page to learn more.

Rulemaking Notices / Public Hearings

  • None at this time.

Pre-Rulemaking Documents / Availability and Opportunities for Public Comment

  • Notice of Availability and Public Comment Period - Integrated Science Assessment: First External Review Draft (PDF)(2 pp, 214 K, November 24, 2015)

Public Meetings / Workshops

  • Notice of CASAC Teleconference on June 11, 2014 (PDF)(2 pp, 214 K, May 27, 2014)
  • Notice of CASAC Teleconference on April 22, 2014 (PDF)(2 pp, 214 K, March 25, 2014) 
  • Notice of Workshop on June 12-13, 2013 and Call for Information on Integrated Science Assessment for Oxides of Sulfur (PDF)(2 pp, 216 K, May 10, 2013)

item.dc:creator: rcopland

item.title: Sulfur Dioxide (SO2) Primary Standards - Integrated Science Assessments from Current Review
item.description:
The integrated science assessment (ISA) in conjunction with additional technical and policy assessments provides the scientific basis for EPA decisions in the review.

  • ISA for Sulfur Oxides - Health Criteria (Second External Review Draft) - December 2016
  • ISA for Sulfur Oxides - Health Criteria (First External Review Draft) - November 2015

You may also be interested in other documents from the current sulfur dioxide primary NAAQS review.
item.dc:creator: rcopland

item.title: Sulfur Dioxide (SO2) Primary Standards - Planning Documents from Current Review
item.description:
Planning documents in NAAQS reviews generally include the Integrated Review Plan and Risk and Exposure Assessment planning documents.

  • Integrated Review Plan for the Primary National Ambient Air Quality Standard for Sulfur Dioxide, Final (PDF)(80 pp, 645 K, October 2014, About PDF)
  • Integrated Review Plan for the Primary National Ambient Air Quality Standard for Sulfur Dioxide, External Review Draft (PDF)(77 pp, 450 K, March 2014, About PDF)

You may also be interested in other documents from the current sulfur dioxide primary NAAQS review.

Over the course of each NAAQS review, EPA publishes notices in the Federal Register for a variety of activities:  the kick-off workshop and call for information, CASAC meetings, availability of pre-rulemaking documents and opportunities for comment on these documents, as well as proposed and final rulemaking decisions and public hearings on a proposed rulemaking decision.

item.dc:creator: rcopland

item.title: Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2) Primary Standards - Policy Assessments from Current Review
item.description:
The policy assessment (PA) presents a staff analysis of the scientific basis for policy options for consideration by senior EPA management prior to rulemaking. Such an evaluation of policy implications is intended to help ‘‘bridge the gap’’ between the Agency’s scientific assessments, presented in the integrated science assessment (ISA) and risk/exposure assessment (REA), and the judgments required of the EPA Administrator in determining whether it is appropriate to retain or revise the NAAQS.

  • Policy Assessment for the Review of the NO2 NAAQS, External Review Draft (PDF)(414 pp, 19.2 M, September 2016, About PDF)

You may also be interested in other documents from the current nitrogen dioxide NAAQS review.
item.dc:creator: aingram
